Sentencas: A ceria catalyst is applied to an inert-substrate supported tubular single cell for direct operation on methane fuel.
Titulo: Ceria catalyst for inert-substrate-supported tubular solid oxide fuel cells running on methane fuel

Sentencas: The tubular single cell comprises a porous yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) supporter, a Ni-Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9 anode, a YSZ/Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9 bi-layer electrolyte, and a La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-delta cathode.
Titulo: Ceria catalyst for inert-substrate-supported tubular solid oxide fuel cells running on methane fuel

Sentencas: The ceria catalyst is incorporated into the porous YSZ supporter layer by a cerium nitrate impregnation.
Titulo: Ceria catalyst for inert-substrate-supported tubular solid oxide fuel cells running on methane fuel

Sentencas: The effects of ceria on the microstructure and electrochemical performance of the tubular single cell are investigated with respect to the number of impregnations.
Titulo: Ceria catalyst for inert-substrate-supported tubular solid oxide fuel cells running on methane fuel

Sentencas: The optimum number of impregnations is determined to be four based on the maximum power density and polarization property of the tubular single cell in hydrogen and methane fuels.
Titulo: Ceria catalyst for inert-substrate-supported tubular solid oxide fuel cells running on methane fuel

Sentencas: At 700 degrees C, the tubular single cell shows similar maximum power densities of similar to 260 mW cm(-2) in hydrogen and methane fuels, respectively.
Titulo: Ceria catalyst for inert-substrate-supported tubular solid oxide fuel cells running on methane fuel

Sentencas: Moreover, the ceria catalyst significantly improves the performance stability of the cell running on methane fuel.
Titulo: Ceria catalyst for inert-substrate-supported tubular solid oxide fuel cells running on methane fuel

Sentencas: At a current density of 350 mA cm(-2), the single cell shows a low degradation rate of 2.5 mV h(-1) during the 13 h test in methane fuel.
Titulo: Ceria catalyst for inert-substrate-supported tubular solid oxide fuel cells running on methane fuel

Sentencas: These results suggest the feasibility of applying the ceria catalyst to the inert-substrate supported tubular single cell for direct operation on methane fuel.
Titulo: Ceria catalyst for inert-substrate-supported tubular solid oxide fuel cells running on methane fuel
